intro: Geissaspis welwitschii var. kapiriensis, commonly known as the Kapiriensis Geissaspis, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
